verses.text: In the first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon Daniel had a dream and visions of his head upon his bed : then he wrote the dream , \add and\add* told the sum of the matters.\f + \fr 7.1 \ft had: Chaldee, saw\f*\f + \fr 7.1 \ft matters: or, words\f*
Daniel spake and said , I saw in my vision by night , and, behold , the four winds of the heaven strove upon the great sea.
And four great beasts came up from the sea , diverse one from another.

The first \add was\add* like a lion , and had eagle’s wings : I beheld till the wings thereof were plucked , and it was lifted up from the earth , and made stand upon the feet as a man , and a man’s heart was given to it.\f + \fr 7.4 \ft and it: or, wherewith it\f*

And behold another beast , a second , like to a bear , and it raised up itself on one side , and \add it had\add* three ribs in the mouth of it between the teeth of it: and they said thus unto it, Arise , devour much flesh.\f + \fr 7.5 \ft it raised…: or, it raised up one dominion\f*
After this I beheld , and lo another , like a leopard , which had upon the back of it four wings of a fowl ; the beast had also four heads ; and dominion was given to it.

After this I saw in the night visions , and behold a fourth beast , dreadful and terrible , and strong exceedingly ; and it had great iron teeth : it devoured and brake in pieces , and stamped the residue with the feet of it: and it \add was\add* diverse from all the beasts that \add were\add* before it; and it had ten horns.

I considered the horns , and, behold , there came up among them another little horn , before whom there were three of the first horns plucked up by the roots : and, behold , in this horn \add were\add* eyes like the eyes of man , and a mouth speaking great things. \p

¶ I beheld till the thrones were cast down , and the Ancient of days did sit , whose garment \add was\add* white as snow , and the hair of his head like the pure wool : his throne \add was like\add* the fiery flame , \add and\add* his wheels \add as\add* burning fire.
A fiery stream issued and came forth from before him: thousand thousands ministered unto him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before him: the judgment was set , and the books were opened.
I beheld then because of the voice of the great words which the horn spake : I beheld \add even\add* till the beast was slain , and his body destroyed , and given to the burning flame.

As concerning the rest of the beasts , they had their dominion taken away : yet their lives were prolonged for a season and time.\f + \fr 7.12 \ft their lives…: Chaldee, a prolonging in life was given them\f*
I saw in the night visions , and, behold , \add one\add* like the Son of man came with the clouds of heaven , and came to the Ancient of days , and they brought him near before him.

And there was given him dominion , and glory , and a kingdom , that all people , nations , and languages , should serve him: his dominion \add is\add* an everlasting dominion , which shall not pass away , and his kingdom \add that\add* which shall not be destroyed. \p
¶ I Daniel was grieved in my spirit in the midst of \add my\add* body , and the visions of my head troubled me.\f + \fr 7.15 \ft body: Chaldee, sheath\f*
I came near unto one of them that stood by , and asked him the truth of all this. So he told me, and made me know the interpretation of the things.
These great beasts , which are four , \add are\add* four kings , \add which\add* shall arise out of the earth.
But the saints of the most High shall take the kingdom , and possess the kingdom for ever , even for ever and ever.\f + \fr 7.18 \ft most…: Chaldee, high ones, that is, things, or, places\f*

Then I would know the truth of the fourth beast , which was diverse from all the others, exceeding dreadful , whose teeth \add were of\add* iron , and his nails \add of\add* brass ; \add which\add* devoured , brake in pieces , and stamped the residue with his feet ;\f + \fr 7.19 \ft from…: Chaldee, from all those\f*

And of the ten horns that \add were\add* in his head , and \add of\add* the other which came up , and before whom three fell ; even \add of\add* that horn that had eyes , and a mouth that spake very great things , whose look \add was\add* more stout than his fellows.
I beheld , and the same horn made war with the saints , and prevailed against them;
Until the Ancient of days came , and judgment was given to the saints of the most High ; and the time came that the saints possessed the kingdom.

Thus he said , The fourth beast shall be the fourth kingdom upon earth , which shall be diverse from all kingdoms , and shall devour the whole earth , and shall tread it down , and break it in pieces.
And the ten horns out of this kingdom \add are\add* ten kings \add that\add* shall arise : and another shall rise after them; and he shall be diverse from the first , and he shall subdue three kings.

And he shall speak \add great\add* words against the most High , and shall wear out the saints of the most High , and think to change times and laws : and they shall be given into his hand until a time and times and the dividing of time.
But the judgment shall sit , and they shall take away his dominion , to consume and to destroy \add it\add* unto the end.

And the kingdom and dominion , and the greatness of the kingdom under the whole heaven , shall be given to the people of the saints of the most High , whose kingdom \add is\add* an everlasting kingdom , and all dominions shall serve and obey him.\f + \fr 7.27 \ft dominions: or, rulers\f*
Hitherto \add is\add* the end of the matter. As for me Daniel , my cogitations much troubled me, and my countenance changed in me : but I kept the matter in my heart.
